body:
atelier iebele abel wrote:


> Hi,
>
> I have downloaded some nice (and very complex)  furniture-geometry 
> from the internet that I like to render in Radiance, but when I create 
> an octree I get the "set overflow in addobject" error. The -r -and -n 
> option do not help.


What do you mean by "the -r option does not work"?  I have had to set -r 
pretty darned high sometimes, to get big models with fine detail to 
compile.  You get a large octree, and it takes a while to generate, but 
it works.  By "pretty darned high", I am talking about -r as high as one 
million.
___
